ch.obermuhlner.jhuge.collection

Class AbstractHugeArrayList<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • ch.obermuhlner.jhuge.collection.AbstractHugeArrayList<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.List<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HugeArrayList, ImmutableHugeArrayList

    public abstract class AbstractHugeArrayList<E>
extends java.util.AbstractList<E>
    An abstract base class to simplify implementing a huge List that mimics an ArrayList.

    The mutating operations are implemented as protected methods with the suffix "Internal".

    • setInternal(int, E)
    • addInternal(int, E)
    • removeInternal(int)
    • clearInternal()

    Immutable concrete subclasses can call these internal methods to implement a builder.

    Mutable concrete subclasses can implement the equivalent public methods by calling the internal methods.

        memoryManager - the MemoryManager
        converter - the element Converter
        faster - true to trade memory consumption for improved performance
        capacity - the initial capacity

      • get

      • setInternal

        protected E setInternal(int index,
            E element)
        Sets an element at the specified index position.

        This method has the same semantics as AbstractList.set(int, Object). Mutable subclasses can implement AbstractList.set(int, Object) by calling this method.

        Immutable subclasses can call this method from the builder.

        Parameters:
        index - the index to insert the element
        element - the element to insert
        Returns:
        the old element

      • addInternal

        protected void addInternal(int index,
               E element)
        Adds an element at the specified index position.

        This method has the same semantics as AbstractList.add(int, Object). Mutable subclasses can implement AbstractList.add(int, Object) by calling this method.

        Immutable subclasses can call this method from the builder.

        Parameters:
        index - the index to insert the element
        element - the element to insert

      • removeInternal

        protected E removeInternal(int index)
        Removes the element at the specified index position.

        This method has the same semantics as AbstractList.remove(int). Mutable subclasses can implement AbstractList.remove(int) by calling this method.

        Immutable subclasses can call this method from the builder.

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the element to remove
        Returns:
        the old element

      • clearInternal

        protected void clearInternal()
        Removes all elements.

        This method has the same semantics as AbstractList.clear(). Mutable subclasses can implement AbstractList.clear() by calling this method.

        Immutable subclasses can call this method from the builder.
